misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No bug / correct parallel-array sorting mental model
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that to sort student records by score using parallel arrays, you must swap both the score and the corresponding name whenever a score swap occurs, and that after sorting ascending the top student is at index n-1.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No conceptual gap detected here. In Java, arrays are indexed collections; swapping corresponding elements in both arrays preserves the name–score association. Bubble sort with the given bounds correctly sorts scores ascending, so the maximum score ends up at the last index.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; output is correct for the stated requirements (assuming N>0 as typical for this question).
